question.text:
Subway Closures

September 24th
Line 2 6:00 A.M - 10:00 A.M
Line 4 10:00 A.M - 11:00 A.M
Line 6 11:00 A.M - 12:00 A.M
Line 7 1:00 P.M - 2:00 P.M

answer.explanation:
W: Did you see this notice? The subways will be out of service during the morning peak time.
M: I know. Q1 The line that we need to catch is closed during morning peak time. Q2 They are having some problems with tracks and they need to fix them. I think it’s a safety issue.
W: It’s very irritating. That’s probably the busiest line at that time of the morning. I don’t know why they decided to do that. 
M: Q2 I think if we get a few other people together, I can drive my car into work. Traffic will be bad but it’s much better than taking the bus.
W: Oh, great idea. I’ll ask around the office and let you know later.

question.text: Why is the subway being closed on September 24th?
Look at the graphic. Which subway line do the speakers need to take?
What does the man suggest doing?

M-Au Oh, I see. Well, 63 I'll go with popcorn.

M: Q1&2 Could I get some information about the interest rates on student loans?
W: The rates depend on your income and the amount of the loan. This brochure explains how to fill out the application forms.
M: I see. And if I send in my application today, how long will it take to be processed? I need to make sure I have money to pay for my classes next month.
W: Q3 It usually takes about four days. The business office can call you as soon as the loan has been approved.

answer.explanation:
W: Nice to meet you, Mr. Gomez. Q1 I’m sure after you hear about our business, you will want us to provide food and beverages for your company’s various events.
M: Nice to meet you, Ms. Gates. Thank you for coming today. I haven’t inquired about your services because your company is located out of town. Q2 I didn’t think you could provide services to US.
W: Rose and Lily Co. is willing to travel anywhere within the state in order to meet our clients’ needs. Our prices don’t change depending on distance, so you don’t need to worry about that.
M: Oh, I’m glad to hear that. In that case, we will consider your services. What are your specialties? Q3 Do you think I could sample some of the food and beverages you provide?

question.text: What kind of services are the speakers discussing?
Why has the man not used Rose and Lily Co.’s services before?
choices: (B) He was reluctant to pay a membership fee.
(C) He was on bad terms with the owner.

answer.text: (D) He did not realize their availability.

question.text: What does the man ask the woman to do?

Transcript: M: Hello. This is Chris Holt calling on behalf of the World Science Fiction Convention. We reserved the conference center at your hotel for our event this weekend. I visited the space today and noticed that there were no tables and chairs set up.
W: The seating will be ready in time for the event. Those items are currently needed for another convention in a different section of the hotel. By the way, exactly how many attendees are you expecting to come?
M: We have 248 confirmed guests. Therefore, we will need around 50 tables with 5 chairs each. Please let me know once these preparations are done.

question.text: Where does the woman work?
Why are the tables and chairs currently unavailable?
choices: (B) The woman didn’t permit their use.

choices: (C) The starting time of an event

W: We have larger sizes, but I don’t think we have any more in white. You can exchange it for another color though.

Mr-Am: Schaffer, the president of Greenwich Industries, just called. He’s looking for a new law firm to represent his company, and he wants to come in on Thursday afternoon at three to discuss our legal services.
M-Au: That’s exciting news—Greenwich Industries is a huge company, and they’d be our biggest client. Could you please reserve conference room A for the meeting? It's our nicest room.
W-Am: Actually, I already tried to, but that meeting room’s already booked at three.
M-Au: Let me take a look Ah, it’s been reserved by Greg. Well, I’m sure Greg wouldn't mind using room B instead.
W-Am: Yeah, that's true. I’ll give him a call and ask him if he's willing to make that change.

answer.explanation:
M-Au : Fiona, Klaus, thanks for meeting with me. You know we're going to start using a new software system for scheduling customer orders. The new program should really improve our factory's efficiency. And...uh... we've decided to start using the software next week.
W-Br : Really? But that means we have to learn the new system as we manage customer orders. l'm worried we won't be able to handle both tasks at the same time.
M-Au : I understand. But the software company is providing US with an on-site coordinator. His name is Mario Jones. He'll help US transition to the new software.
M-Cn : OK, good. Does he know our old system, too?
M-Au : Yes, that's the best part. Mario has experience with both programs, so things should go smoothly.

question.text: What is the conversation mainly about?
What is the woman concerned about?

choices: (C)He is familiar with two computer programs.
(D)He can fix many types of equipment.

answer.text: (C)He is familiar with two computer programs.

M-Au: Yes, I was wondering when the busiest times are here.

M-Cn : Actually, 51is it OK if we move the deadline to the end of next week?
M-Cn : Well, the interview with Katherine went really well, and I'm almost finished writing the article. But because of a scheduling conflict, she had to cancel the photo shoot I'd set up.
W-Am : Have you been able to schedule another one?
M-Cn : Yes. Katherine's agreed to meet me on Saturday morning so I can take some photos before her afternoon performance.

Transcript:
W: Hello, this is Suzy Smith calling for Dan Harmon. I work at Danny Sweets. I’m calling to let you know that the wedding cake you ordered is ready to be picked up at any time.
M: Oh, thanks for calling. I’m extremely busy making other preparations for the wedding tomorrow and won’t have time to stop by. Can you deliver the cake instead?
W: I’m sorry, but we don’t offer any delivery service. However, if you give us a name in advance, you could have someone else pick it up for you.
M: OK, I’ll try to find someone to do that for me. I’ll call back later.

question.text: Where most likely does the woman work?

choices: (A) He has urgent arrangements to make.
(B) He must attend a wedding today.
(D) He has to prepare an order.

answer.text: (A) He has urgent arrangements to make.

question.text: What information will the man probably provide?

answer.explanation:
W: This is Eva Flores. I’ve been a patient of Dr. Morgan’s for some time now, but I’ll be moving to Boston for my work. Q1 I’m calling to see if I can get a copy of my medical records to take with me.
M; You could, Q2 but our usual policy is to transfer patient records directly to the doctor. Do you have a phone number for your new medical office? I could call there and arrange to send the records.
W: I don’t know yet who my new doctor will be. Would it be a problem if you have to keep my files for a while? I’ll let you know as soon as I know who I’ll be seeing.
MB: No, that’s no problem at all. But first, Q3 you’ll have to sign a form giving us your permission. You’re required to do that before we can send any information.

question.text: What are the speakers discussing?
What information does the man request?
What will the woman be required to do?

answer.explanation:
W: Here is the office space you asked me about. Q1 It is hot inside because the air conditioners have been off, but usually the temperature is fine. What do you think?
M: It’s quite nice. There is a lot of natural sunlight which I really like.
W: Me too. It’s a little small but we only have five employees so it would be fine.
M: Is there any public transport close by? Some of our employees take the subway to work.
W: Yes. Actually, the Brighton street stop is about a five minute walk so it’s pretty close.
M: Q2 The only problem is the carpet. It’s quite dirty. Does the owner plan on changing it anytime soon?
W: Q3 Actually, we are having new carpets put in next week. So don’t worry about that. If you sign the contract you won’t move your stuff in for a month.
M: That’s great. I think we will take it. When do we need to sign the contract?
W: I will prepare it when I get back to the office and we can sign it all tomorrow afternoon.

question.text: Why was it hot inside the office?
choices: (D) The air conditioner had been off

answer.text: (D) The air conditioner had been off

question.text: What is the man’s problem with the office?
choices: (A) There was no public transport close by.

question.text: How does the woman respond to the man's problem?
choices: (A) She tells him they are putting in new carpets.
(B) She tells him that the carpets aren’t dirty.
(C) She prepares the contract for tomorrow.

answer.text: (A) She tells him they are putting in new carpets.

M-Cn 89 Our next agenda item is about the surveys we mailed to everyone who purchased a vehicle from our dealership last year. As you'll recall, 90we designed the surveys to find out how satisfied our customers were with the service they received from us. The surveys were sent out a month ago, and I’m happy to report that 60 percent of them have already been completed and returned to us! Now, this is an incredibly high number—91 I’m sure this is because we promised to wash their car for free if they turned in a completed survey. So let's keep this incentive in mind next time we need to collect customer feedback.

Customers get really confused and upset when the price of a product is displayed incorrectly. answer.explanation: (M-Au): Hi, this is Alex from maintenance. Q1 I got your call about the light switch in your office that isn't working. answer.explanation:
Transcript:
W-Br OK everyone, before you head out to the factory floor this morning to start your shifts, I have a brief announcement. As most of you know, the new conveyor belt is now installed and up and running. This new conveyor belt is very similar to the older model, except it’s twice as fast as the old one. This means that our factory can now move double the number of units per hour. Clearly, this is a big improvement in production speed. However, it could also be a challenge for us to watch out for production errors. So,you’re all required to watch a short training video this morning before starting work.

question.text: What is the speaker mainly discussing?
What key difference does the speaker point  out?
What does the speaker say the listeners must do?

answer.explanation: W-Am: Q1 In today's manager's meeting we need to address some comments we've received from customers about our health-food store. Over the last month customers have complained that weekly sale items are not available - so they're leaving the store without being able to purchase those items. Q2 This is a concern because we do have more of the items in our storage area, but the shelves are not being restocked in a timely manner. Q3 One solution is to hire some additional employees to assist in keeping the shelves full during our busiest shopping hours. Q3 We'll begin advertising for the new positions starting next week.

question.text: What is the speaker discussing?
What problem does the speaker point out?
choices: (B) Uniforms still need to be ordered.
(D)  Certain products cannot be found on the shelves.

answer.text: (D)  Certain products cannot be found on the shelves.

question.text: What is the speaker planning to do?

answer.explanation: OK everyone, I have one final reminder before we end this meeting. Since all of the cashiers are present, I want to remind you of an important step in customer transactions here at GL Supermarket. As you know, many of our customers are part of our membership program, which means that they receive five percent off their purchase when you swipe their membership card. Please remember that it is our responsibility to ask customers for their membership card when scanning their groceries. If a customer doesn’t have a membership card, make sure to mention that applications are available at the customer service desk.

question.text: Who most likely are the listeners?
What is the purpose of the talk?
choices: (B) To remind staff of a sales procedure
(C) To update staff on a safety policy

answer.text: (B) To remind staff of a sales procedure

question.text: What is available at the customer service desk?

answer.explanation: (W-Am): Hello. Q1 I'm calling from the Pine Hill Medical Clinic about your appointment with Dr. Smith on August fourth at ten A M. Q2 I want to remind you that our office has recently relocated. We're now in the new medical professional building at the corner of Cooper Avenue and Main Street. Q3 Will you please call us back at 555-0145 to confirm that you'll keep your appointment? Thank you.

question.text: Where is the speaker calling from?
According to the speaker, what has recently changed?
Why should the listener return the call?

answer.explanation: My name is Ned, and I’ll be your guide on today’s zoo tour. The fenced pathways will lead us past areas where our animals are allowed to roam free. I’m sure you’ll be impressed with the natural habitats that have been carefully recreated for our zoo animals to live in. At the end of the tour, we II visit the gift shop, where I suggest you pick up a copy of All Our Animals, a guidebook that has beautiful pictures of the animals you'll see today. And please remember, don't make phone calls on your cell phone during the tour.

question.text: According to the speaker, what is impressive about the zoo?
choices: (A) It was featured in a documentary.
(B) It is fully funded by the government.

question.text: What does the speaker recommend doing after the tour?
What does the speaker say is not allowed during the tour?

answer.explanation: (W-Br): Attention, shoppers. Come to the bookstore's cafe in fifteen minutes to meet Q1 office productivity expert, Robert Bellman. Mr. Bellman will share tips from his new book, Organize and Be Productive. Q2 He'll present strategies for uncluttering your desk, creating a filing system, and making your workspace more efficient. Q3 Afterwards, he'll sign copies of his book, which are available for purchase by the cash registers.

question.text: Who is Robert Bellman?
What is the topic of Robert Bellman’s talk?
What will happen after the talk?
The purchasing department is located ___ the reception desk.

answer.explanation: (C) “Behind” is logical and does not need other words to complete the expression. Choice (A) requires “frow” (across from the reception desk). Choice (B) requires a second location (between the reception desk and the door). Choice (D) is not logical.

question.text: The bookcase is___the door.

answer.explanation: (A) “Beside” means “next to”. Choices (B) and (C) require more than one reference point. Choice (D) should be “across from”.

question.text: If you wish to cancel your subscription to The Steele Lake Ledger, please be sure ___ for four weeks of processing time.

answer.explanation: Be sure to do st = Remember to do st

question.text: Great ___ in tourism levels have had a significant impact on the success of Darling Beach’s small businesses.

answer.explanation: Fluctuation = Frequent change

question.text: The judges may begin to review the entries ______ the deadline for submitting slogans has passed.

answer.explanation:
Now that = because
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer => C

question.text: Our department  _____the policy meeting last Monday, but we had a scheduling  conflict.

answer.explanation:
We have an adverb of time "last time"
=> Verbs must be in the past tense
=> A,C are wrong
Based on the meaning of 2 answer B and D to choose the correct answer
=>D

question.text: The Green Society is dedicated to ______ public parks and other natural areas for future generations.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer
=> A

question.text: The cost of repairing the water damage to the museum after the storm ___ to be more than one million dollars.

answer.explanation: Expect sb/st to do st

question.text: ___we were late, we could not enter the conference hall.

answer.explanation: (B) Because establishes a cause-and-effect relationship. Choice (A) indicates a contrast. Choices (C) and (D) are used with clauses expressing a result.

question.text: Ding's Cafe in Hong Kong ------- to serve the freshest possible seafood.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer

question.text: This year’s company retreat will focus on techniques that help people think more _____.

answer.explanation: Based on structure: help somebody (to) do (something)

question.text: Due to congestion on the roads, an increasing number of manufacturers  _____  transport their goods by train.

answer.explanation:
The answers A, B, D are grammatically incorrect
=> Choose C

question.text: Fargo Electronics has___ halted production of its newest line of video games until retailers have sold off the existing surplus.

answer.explanation: Temporarily = For a short time

question.text: The Parks and Recreation Department offers _____ opportunities for volunteers to improve the community.

answer.explanation:
We need an adjective to modify noun "opportunities" => rewarding (adj)
=> Choose D

question.text: The leadership conference will be held in Lanesviiie, which is about 50 miles from downtown Seattle and easily accessible ___ car or train.

answer.explanation: Be accessible by + Transportation = Can be reached by a transportation

question.text: Since Alfonso Basitian is such a great ------- to the company, he was promoted to division manager.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of words.

question.text: Ms. Pieraccini had ___ finished editing the budget report when she noticed an error In the title page.

answer.explanation:
Nearly = Almost
"Nearly" is the only answer that comes before verbs.

question.text: ………………………reducing staff, management made the decision to decrease administrative bonuses.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer
=> A

question.text: Matos Realty has developed two  _____  methods of identifying undervalued properties.

answer.explanation:
Before N is an adjective
=> A

question.text: The upscale boutique Jane’s Closet is known for selling the most stylish _____  for young professionals.

answer.explanation:
The missing position is after an adjective, we need to add a noun
=> Choose A

question.text: Because of a mechanical failure in the production facility, Fizzy Bottlers will be closed_____further notice.

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning to choose the correct answer => D

question.text: The Silvau Division is now ___ a full line of steel products at a new modern facility just outside the city.

answer.explanation:
The answer comes after "is now" so we use present continuous tense. There is no "by" after the answer so we use the active voice "is manufacturing".
Manufacture = Produce

question.text: The initial response to the beta version of the software allows us to be ______ optimistic about future product sales,

answer.explanation: Need an adverb to modify the adjective “optimistic”

question.text: Despite receiving rejections from several major publishers, Ian Wright  _____  to become a world-famous novelist.

answer.explanation:
The first side has "despite" => clauses mean opposition
Based on the meaning of words
=>Choose D

question.text: The updated safety manual includes guidelines  ______ the entire factory.

answer.explanation:
Based on the meaning of the word to choose the correct answer
=> D

question.text: Although Mr. Akiyama retired last year, he…………………visits the office each week.

answer.explanation:
Choose the correct answer based on the meaning of the sentence.
=> C

question.text: In the photograph, President Tang can be seen standing  _____ Dr. Dervishi.

answer.explanation:

question.text:
To: Samuel Archerson [sarcherson@vona.co.uk]
From: James Darrers [jdarrers@sky.co.uk]
Date: 10 January
Subject: Cost Accountant position

Dear Mr. Archerson,
Thank you for taking the time to meet with me today. I ----1--- our conversation, and I remain very interested in the position of cost accountant. I would welcome the opportunity to return for the third and final round of ---2---- .
I am confident my years of accounting experience would benefit your firm. As discussed, over the last ten years, I have helped many companies save a ---3---- amount of money. I am especially adept at analysing the day-to-day operations of a business and helping to determine more cost-effective methods.
I checked regarding your question about a potential start date. ---4---- . I hope to hear from you in the near future.
Sincerely,
James Darrers

answer.explanation: Select (B) because the previous sentence thanks for the time to speak, so the verb needs to divide the past simple tense.
Based on meaning  to choose the correct answer
Select (D) according to the structure: the article (a) + adjective + noun (amount of money).

choices: (A) I have four additional questions to ask you.
(B) I would be able to begin during the first week of February.
(C) I am confident I have the potential for this position.
(D) Thank you for the offer of employment.

answer.text: (B) I would be able to begin during the first week of February.
answer.explanation: Select (B) because the sentence before the phrase 'start date'

question.text:
A History of Sports from Ancient Times to the Present
By Rebecca Jean Porter
Illustrated, 248 pp.
Oakview Press, Westport, CT $32.95

Rebecca Jean Porter, the author of Olympic Dreams, has attained another perfect score in this engaging and readable history. A History of Sports from Ancient Times to the Present covers everything from sporting events in ancient Rome to the origins of team sports in North America, and it includes a section on sports played on contemporary university campuses. I highly recommend the chapter with detailed instructions on how to play games that had previously been lost over time. Porter’s comprehensive introduction and bibliography, as well as the time line of dates and events, make this a reference work that should be purchased by all public libraries. An online companion volume will be published next year.
- Andrew Huff
What does Andrew Huff suggest about the book?
choices: (A) it is not as good as Olympic Dreams.
(B) it does not cover previous centuries in detail.

answer.explanation: Information can be referred from: "A History of Sports from Ancient Times to the Present covers everything from sporting events in ancient Rome to the origins of team sports in North America, and it includes a section on sports played on contemporary university campuses. I highly recommend the chapter with detailed instructions on how to play games that had previously been lost over time. Porter’s comprehensive introduction and bibliography, as well as the time line of dates and events, make this a reference work that should be purchased by all public libraries."

question.text: What is NOT mentioned as being included in the book?

answer.explanation:
Porter’s comprehensive introduction and bibliography, as well as the time line of dates and events, make this a reference work that should be purchased by all public libraries. => Eliminate B&C
A History of Sports from Ancient Times to the Present covers everything from sporting events in ancient Rome to the origins of team sports in North America => Eliminate A

question.text:
Attention West Arragon Residents:
The West Arragon Business Directory has grown so large that it takes up a sizable portion of the neighborhood newsletter. As a result, we will no longer be printing the directory on paper and will offer it online instead.
The directory is not posted yet, but it will be found at www.westarragon.com in the next few weeks. When it becomes available, I suggest that you review your listing to make sure it is accurate. If you find that your listing is out of date or has a link that does not work, please let me know so that I can make the necessary changes.

Thanks,
Judy Lanster
West Arragon Neighborhood Council
555-0013
What change will be made to the business directory?
choices: (B) It will be available only online.
(C) It will be distributed on a different date.
(D) It will cover more than one neighborhood.

answer.text: (B) It will be available only online.
answer.explanation: We will no longer be printing the directory on paper and will offer it online instead.

question.text: According to the notice, why might readers contact Ms. Lanster?

answer.explanation: If you find that your listing is out of date or has a link that does not work, please let me know.

Once you take the television home and install it, it begins working with your preferences immediately without annoying adjustments.

711 Market Street

Date Flight No. Place/Time Depart Place/Time Arrive

To help us continue to improve, please visit our Web site at www.excelonts.com and fill out our customer satisfaction survey.

Janet S. Ono
Customer Service Associate

question.text:
Auckland Daily Chronicle

Business Briefs

AUCKLAND (6 June) - Ann Marie Haas, former executive director of Gear Good, a company that develops and sells software for bike-sharing companies, has a new but related position. —[1]—. Beginning in November, she will be general manager of City Wheels, a bike-sharing company in Auckland. — [2]—. The move comes at an opportune moment for both Ms. Haas and City Wheels. Ms. Haas had worked for Gear Good in Wellington since the company was founded five years ago but was yearning to return to Auckland, where she grew up. City Wheels was looking for a new leader to oversee its planned expansion from 50 to 75 bike stations in Auckland. —[3] —. “I’m thrilled to join a company that’s important to residents and tourists alike,” Ms. Haas said.
The City Wheels system is simple and affordable for occasional use. —[4] —. The first thirty minutes of biking are free, and after that, the cost is $4 per hour or $20 per day. Ms. Haas said she is enthusiastic about this venture, both for herself and for the city of Auckland. - Tahei Davis, Staff Writer
What is the purpose of the article?
choices: (A) To describe the financial difficulties a business is facing
(B) To announce the launch of a new software company
(C) To report on an executive's career move
(D) To assess recent tourism trends in Auckland

answer.text: (C) To report on an executive's career move
answer.explanation: The information can be inferred from: "Ann Marie Haas, former executive director of Gear Good, a company that develops and sells software for bike-sharing companies, has a new but related position."

question.text: What does City Wheels expect to do?

answer.explanation: The information is in: "City Wheels was looking for a new leader to oversee its planned expansion from 50 to 75 bike stations in Auckland. "

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2, [3] and [4] does the following sentence best belong?
“A modest $5 registration fee is required to begin using City Wheels bikes.”

answer.explanation: The sentence after position [4] mentions the cost of hiring bike.

question.text:
Grand Opening!


The owner of Woodcraft Designs is pleased to announce the opening of her second store in Falls City. The new store will offer high-quality wood furniture, with an emphasis on pieces made to customer specifications. Abigail Hurst, who opened the original Woodcraft Designs location on High Street five years ago, leads a small team of experienced, talented furniture makers whose unique creations will be displayed in both stores. Although Hurst’s pieces cover a range of styles and periods, the new store will showcase the company’s remarkable replicas of Victorian-style furniture made from fine quality cherry, oak, and mahogany woods.

Hurst’s craftwork has earned her a reputation as a master artisan in her field. Her reconstruction of a nineteenth-century dressing table was the subject of a lengthy article in Classics of Woodwork on methods and techniques of precision woodcutting. In addition, photographs of some of her best pieces have appeared in Today’s Space, which features information about houses and buildings that are known for their impressive furnishings and decor. Ms. Hurst will divide her time between the old and new store locations.
What is the purpose of the notice?
choices: (A)To announce the publication of a new book
(B)To describe a recent trend in architecture
(D)To invite people to apply for a job

answer.explanation: Information in the sentences: "The new store will offer high-quality wood furniture, with an emphasis on pieces made to customer specifications. Abigail Hurst, who opened the original Woodcraft Designs location on High Street five years ago, leads a small team of experienced, talented furniture makers whose unique creations will be displayed in both stores. Although Hurst’s pieces cover a range of styles and periods, the new store will showcase the company’s remarkable replicas ofVictorian-style furniture made from fine quality cherry, oak, and mahogany woods."

question.text: Who Is Ms. Hurst?

answer.explanation: "Although Hurst’s pieces cover a range of styles and periods, the new store will showcase the company’s remarkable replicas ofVictorian-style furniture made from fine quality cherry, oak, and mahogany woods." and "Hurst’s craftwork has earned her a reputation as a master artisan in her field." => It can inferred that Ms. Hurst is a furniture maker

question.text: What are the articles in Today's Space mostly about?

answer.explanation: Based on words like  Woodcraft Designs,  wood furniture, furniture makers, craftwork, furnishings and decor, etc. Besides, you need to skim the passage to answer this question.

question.text:
Saying Yes to Financial Success
EDINBURGH (3 April)—Yolanda Abascal had intended to study fashion design when she first entered university in Manchester 30 years ago. But while working one summer’ at a small clothing boutique, she discovered a love for retail. — [1] —. To pursue her new dream, she earned a business degree instead and opened a small store in her hometown of Edinburgh called Say Yes To Yolanda.
Fast-forward to today, and Ms. Abascal’s small store has expanded to a successful enterprise that earns millions of pounds each year. — [2] —. This success is in part due to the magic of Vihaan Kulkarni, whom Ms. Abascal hired four years ago to develop a parallel virtual store, YesYolanda.com. It was Mr. Kulkarni’s idea to rename the flagship store Yes Yolanda to match its digital identity.
Ms. Abascal is a strong proponent of personal interaction, and she loves engaging with her customers. — [3] —. However, she realizes that an online presence is important. Yes Yolanda expects earnings from online sales alone to rise to more than £140 million this year. Nearly two-thirds of these sales will come from outside Scotland, mainly the United States, Singapore, and Australia.
Yes Yolanda’s workforce has expanded accordingly. Besides hiring people with technical skills to update and run the Web site, the company has just added an in-house photography studio.

“The studio ensures that items are photographed in a timely fashion for online display,” said Ms. Abascal. “This is a necessity, since new products are added every week.” — [4] —.
Although Ms. Abascal says she does not know what the future holds, it would seem that the only direction for Yes Yolanda is up.
What is the purpose of the article?
choices: (C)To illustrate how a business has grown

answer.text: (C)To illustrate how a business has grown
answer.explanation: The article talks about the development and success of a fashion company from the past to the present => choose answer C

question.text: What is indicated about Yes Yolanda?
choices: (A)Its sales have held steady for years.
(B)it opened its first store in Manchester.
(C)Its Web designer recently won an award.
(D)It used to be known by a different name.

answer.text: (D)It used to be known by a different name.
answer.explanation: Paragraph "rename the flagship store to Yes Yolanda to match its digital identity" Contains rename meaning to change the name to have the same title as the electric store => D

question.text: The word “fashion” in paragraph 5, line 2, is closest in meaning to

answer.explanation: The word fashion is used in a sense of manner, performance => manner

question.text:
In which of the positions marked [1], [2], [3], and [4] does the following sentence best belong?
“She still believes she can best meet their needs when they shop at her physical store.”

answer.explanation: Based on the meaning of the questions before and after, choose answer C that is related to the customer, and satisfies customer requirements.

question.text:
SAFETY REGULATIONS
Personal Protective Equipment (PPE}


Items of personal protective equipment (PPE) such as face shields, safety glasses, safety shoes, and high-visibility vests should only be used if they are in good, undamaged condition. While the durability of PPE items varies from three months to two years, most items used by TBNC personnel remain in good condition for up to six months. TBNC routinely conducts inspections of every PPE item twice a year, but an item must be replaced as soon as it is torn or damaged, even if that occurs before one of the official inspections.

Whenever you need to replace a PPE item, you should file a request for a new one with your supervisor. The supervisor will inquire about the nature of your work (nighttime work, repaving, maintenance work, etc.) to make sure you are being provided with the proper PPE item or items. Once you have received a replacement PPE item, you should dispose of the item that is being replaced in one of the specially designated bins. These are located in room 2B of the main office. Please do your part to maintain the company’s excellent safety record!
What is the notice about?
choices: (B)Ways of preparing work sites for inspection

answer.explanation: The information is inferred from: "Items of personal protective equipment (PPE) such as face shields, safety glasses, safety shoes, and high-visibility vests should only be used if they are in good, undamaged condition." and "Whenever you need to replace a PPE item, you should file a request for a new one with your supervisor."

question.text: How often are inspections performed?

answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: " TBNC routinely conducts inspections of every PPE item twice a year"

question.text: According to the notice, what information will the supervisor request?
choices: (B)The type of work an employee performs
(C)The date of the last PPE inspection
(D)The number of hours an employee usually works

answer.text: (B)The type of work an employee performs
answer.explanation: Information in the sentence: "The supervisor will inquire about the nature of your work (nighttime work, repaving, maintenance work, etc.) to make sure you are being provided with the proper PPE item or items."

question.text: According to the notice, what should employees do with a PPE item that can no longer be used?
choices: (A)Keep it until the next scheduled inspection
(B)Clean it and send it for recycling

answer.explanation: Information in the sentences: "Once you have received a replacement PPE item, you should dispose of the item that is being replaced in one of the specially designated bins. These are located in room 2B of the main office."

question.text:
Travel & Recreation

123 Gilmore street

Orange County, CA 48857


November 15
Mr. Peter Kang
3820 Rivervalley Heights
Seattle, WA 19387

We at Travel & Recreation thank you for your subscription to our magazine. As you have been a long time subscriber, I am excited to inform you about our new subscription plan for our VIP members. - [1] - As a member, you will continue to receive monthly editions of our magazine and access to our new online e-magazine services. You can simply download a digital version of the print magazine to any mobile device at no extra cost. -[2] - Furthermore, you can access background information about our authors, journalists, and guest writers, as well as detailed information about the locations and places that are covered in the magazine. In addition, you can access the recipes to the most popular restaurants around the world and, most exciting of all, we will hold an exclusive competition for our VIP members with a chance to win a trip for two to Hawaii. -[3] - Our regular subcribers, as well as VIP members, will have a chance to win a dining experience at 5-star restaurant Bellisimo.

Again we thank you for your continued support and we hope you enjoy the many changes we have made to our services as we strive to entertain and educate our loyal subscribers. - [4] - Please fill out the application form that is attached to this letter. Please check which subscription plan you wish to join. If you send in a $100 fee, you will receive the regular subscription plan. If you send in $200 fee, you will become a VIP member.

We appreciate your support and hope to hear from you soon.

Sincerely,
Victoria Adams
Why was a letter sent to Mr. Kang?
choices: (A) To remind him to send in his travel journals
(B) To explain about a new subscription plan
(C) To inquire about his travel plans
(D) To determine his qualifications for a position

answer.text: (B) To explain about a new subscription plan
answer.explanation: “We at Travel & Recreation thank you for your subscription to our magazine. As you have been a long time subscriber, I am excited to inform you about our new subscription plan for our VIP members. ”

question.text: What did Ms. Adams send with the letter?

answer.explanation: "Please fill out the application form that is attached to this letter".

question.text: In the middle of the first paragraph of the letter, the term “at no extra cost” is closest in meaning to:

answer.explanation: "You can simply download a digital version of the print magazine to any mobile device at no extra cost."

question.text:

“Your subscription expires next month, but we invite you to consider joining our VIP membership.”

question.text:
April 5—Clearwater Hospital in downtown Scranton has launched a new pen pal letter-writing program between terminally ill hospital patients and adult volunteers. Hospital Director Zack Chambers, who was recently presented with an Outstanding Leader Award from the National Health Care Alliance, started the program to create stronger connections between the hospital and the community. Mr. Chambers encourages adults of all types and occupations to apply even if they don’t feel completely qualified. Simply visit the Clearwater Hospital website and become a member of the hospital free of charge.
“I hope through this program, volunteers can form close relationships with patients to help them get through these difficult times in their lives,” said Mr. Chambers. He also hopes that the program will lead to more people visiting terminally ill patients in person.

==========================

Clearwater Hospital
May 4
Monica Greene
4100 Washington Road
Scranton, Wisconsin 54481

Dear Ms. Greene,

I was delighted to receive your letter. I am very excited to have been paired with you as pen pals. I hope we can learn a lot from each other and build a lasting friendship.

As you know, I live in California, which is a long way from Wisconsin. I hope that in the coming months I can find some time off work and visit you. Please let me know when the most convenient time would be for me to meet you.

I look forward to hearing from you,
Jessica Wright

===========================

Dear Jessica,

You don’t know how much I appreciate your kind words. Although the staff at Clearwater are very kind, I feel the need to connect with people who are not part of the staff. My surviving family also live a great distance away, in Florida, and so most of the time I am just communicating with the paid staff or the other patients. I would welcome a visit, if you truly wanted to come, and the best time would be for our meeting is the Thanksgiving holiday party here at the center I suppose. My own family might be here as well. If it is too much for you, or if you can’t get the time off of work, don’t worry about it too much. I do hope that we can continue to communicate through our letters.

All the best,
Monica Greene
What is the article about?

answer.explanation: Clearwater hospital in downtown Scranton has Launched a new pen pal letter- writing program terminally ill hospital giữa Patients and adult volunteers.

question.text: What is mentioned about Mr. Chambers?
choices: (A) He is a patient at Clearwater Hospital.
(B) He teaches writing skills to adults.
(C) He is the head of a health care organization.
(D) He was honored for his leadership.

answer.text: (D) He was honored for his leadership.
answer.explanation: ... Zack Chambers, who was recently presented with an Outstanding Leader Award from the National Health Care Alliance.

question.text: What does Mr. Chambers invite people to do?

answer.explanation: He also hopes that the program will lead to more people visiting terminally ill patients in person

question.text: Who does Monica Greene spend most of her time with?

answer.explanation: ...so most of the time I am just communicating with the paid staff or the other patients.

question.text: When does Monica Greene want Jessica to visit?

answer.explanation: ... and the best time would be for our meeting is the Thanksgiving holiday party here at the center I suppose ...

question.text:
Quipwerx Support Request Form
Complete and submit this form to create a support ticket number. We will e-mail you a response within 24 hours.
Name: Agnes Kowalsi
Company: Alexsy Corportation
E-mail Address: akowalski@alexsycorp.net
Subject: Web-conferencing issues
Please describe the problem you are experiencing.
We started using your Web-conferencing software in June and have been pleased with it overall. Yesterday, however, we had several interruptions in service during an important training session. In the middle of our meeting, the screen suddenly went black and a notice appeared stating, “Quipwerx is down for maintenance.” Several employees were calling in from overseas, and after this notice appeared multiple times, we decided to reschedule. Is there a way for you to inform us of your maintenance schedule in advance? If not, I will probably terminate my membership. I must be confident that I can use your product anytime I need it.
======================
To: Agnes Kowalski - akowalski@alexsycorp.net
From: Quipwerx Support - support@quipwerxsoftware.com
Date: July 29
Subject: Ticket: 000125659 –Web Conferencing Issues
Dear Ms. Kowalski,
Thank you for contacting us with your concerns. The issue you had this past Wednesday was caused by servers that crashed due to a database communication issue. We could not anticipate this problem, so we were unable to warn customers in advance. I assure you that this type of occurrence is very rare.
In light of your comments, we have decided to reword our alert message from “down for maintenance” to “experiencing technical difficulties.” That way customers will know the problem is due to unforeseen circumstances rather than routine maintenance. As a matter of fact, our software is hardly ever down for maintenance. When we work on an upgrade, the software is unavailable for just a few minutes, if at all.
We regret the inconvenience this has caused you and are truly grateful for your feedback. In appreciation of your business, we will be waiving the service fee on your company account for this month.
Sincerely,
Cindy Trautman,
Quipwerx Support
What does Ms. Kowalski request on the online form?
choices: (D)A new time for a training session

answer.explanation: The article mentions the phrase "down for maintenance" and she is explaining the problem she is having and asking for information about the "inform about maintenance schedule".

question.text: What is suggested about Ms. Kowalski ?

answer.explanation: The whole paragraph in the form section states that she uses the software for 'training => only answer C is reasonable.

question.text: What is Ms. Kowalski's complaint regarding Quipwerx conferencing software?
choices: (A)It does not serve her current purposes.
(D)It cannot be used by her overseas clients.

answer.explanation: Because she had the problem "had several interruptions" she thought the software was unreliable and terminate my membership.

question.text: What does Ms. Trautman say Ouipwerx will change?

answer.explanation: In the response message saying "decide to reword our alert message" means to decide to change the notification message.

question.text: What is indicated about Alexsy Corporation?
choices: (D)It pays a monthly fee to Ouipwerx.

answer.text: (D)It pays a monthly fee to Ouipwerx.
answer.explanation: Due to the problem above, Quipwerx company will refund this month fee (will be waiving the service fee on your company ...) => Alexsy company needs to pay monthly fee => answer D

question.text:
To:Sally Russell srussell@ptmail.com
From:Kelly Bennett kbennett@msplanning.com
Date:December 7
Subject: Wedding Services
Attachment: Packages

Dear Ms. Russell

,We received your e-mail on Tuesday, December 4, inquiring about our wedding planning and event services. We specialize in all kinds of weddings (small- or large-scale, indoor or outdoor, and various kinds of decors tailored to your dream wedding). We are sure to have a solution just right for you.

You wrote that you want a wedding package that is less than $5,000 and that will be held at a large venue close to a major highway because you expect many guests from all over the country. As I understand it, your other preferences are as follows:

• an outdoor venue
• a photographer and videographer available at all times for documentation
• decorations including colorful flowers and elegant tablecloths

I've attached a list of all our possible wedding packages that you might be interested in. They are all located within 15 minutes' drive of Highway 519. Please look through the provided information to decide which location fits your needs best. Once you have made a decision, please inform me via e-mail when you would like the wedding to be held. This will help me secure a reservation for you.

Thanks,

Kelly Bennett
MS Planning

==============================

Package Total Fee Location Notes
Diamond $5,500 Hardy Theater Everything from the Emerald package, plus a live string quartet
Emerald $4,300 Zenith Park Everything from the Ruby package, plus photo and video shoots
Ruby $3,000 Country Springs Hotel Everything from the Sapphire package, plus decorated tables and beautiful flowers
Sapphire $$1,750 Jubilee Garden Buffet lunch and a variety of beverages
What is suggested about all the locations on the list?
choices: (A) They are close to a main road.
(C) They are located in the same city.

answer.text: (A) They are close to a main road.
answer.explanation:
“They are all located within 15 minutes' drive of Highway 519”
So these locations are all located near the main road.

question.text: What package would probably best suit Ms. Russell’s needs?

answer.explanation:
In the email there were requests by Ms. Russel “less than $ 5,000”, “a photographer and videographer”,
“colorful flowers and elegant tablecloths”. In the packages given, the package that meets the requirements is the Emerald package.

question.text: What can be inferred about Ms. Russell?
choices: (D) She works for a catering company.

answer.explanation: This email was sent to Miss Russell because she asked about the wedding packages. So it can be deduced she was engaged and about to be married.

question.text: What information is Ms. Russell asked to provide?

answer.explanation: Information is in the sentence near the bottom of the email “please inform me via email when you would like the wedding to be held”

question.text: Who most likely is Ms. Bennett?

answer.explanation: Ms. Bennet is the person who emails MS planning services to Ms Russel, so she can work as an event planner.

question.text:
September 21—What is the secret to delicious home-cooked meals? Kimberly Lee, host of the My Home Cooking television show and owner of her own restaurant chain, seems to know all the secrets. Her show has been on the air for over two years, and now she has a devoted group of followers around the country. When she sat down for an interview with US, she said that fresh vegetables and local produce are the key to cooking healthy and tasty food.
Ms. Lee is scheduled to publish her very first cookbook near the end of the month. The book is entitled Kimberly Lee’s My Home Cooking, and it provides easy-to- follow recipes that can be made in less than 30 minutes. Over 40,000 copies have already been pre-ordered so far.
Ms. Lee says that the final page of the book will include a detachable fan club membership form. Those who fill the form out and send it in to the provided address will receive a monthly newsletter and exclusive recipes available only to those in the fan club. Fan club members will also receive a password that allows access to a fan club website.

===========================

To: Kimberly Lee-kimberlylee@kimberlylee.com
From: Suzie Sanders - suziesanders@kimberlylee.com
Date: October 12
Subject: Update

Dear Ms. Lee,
Great news! I’m happy to report that not only has your book been selling well, but the number of new members joining the fan club has been increasing drastically since it was published. I’m certain that the article in the newspaper helped generate considerable publicity for your book.
Also, we have received a lot of feedback from new members expressing a desire for more recipes for cakes, cookies, and candies to be featured in next month’s newsletter. I think it would be a good idea to meet their needs this time.
Sincerely,

Suzie Sanders Publicity
Coordinator
What is the first thing to do in order to become a fan club member?

answer.explanation: At the end of the article she Lee says the last page of the book has a membership registration form. So to be able to get the registration form, the first thing to do is to buy that book.

question.text: What is the main purpose of the article?
choices: (B) To provide advice for professional chefs

answer.explanation: It is easy to see that the main content of the article is about Ms. Lee and her upcoming book. So the correct answer is A.

question.text: What is suggested about next month’s newsletter?
choices: (A) It will be mailed behind schedule.
(B) It will feature a column about healthy eating habits.
(C) It will contain an article on desserts.
(D) It will include a copy of Ms. Lee’s book.

answer.text: (C) It will contain an article on desserts.
answer.explanation:
Derived from the last two sentences of the letter: “Also, we have received a lot of feedback from new members expressing a desire for more recipes for cakes, cookies, and candies to be featured in next month's newsletter. I think it would be a good idea to meet their needs this time. ”
So if they meet the members' request, next month's letter will have recipes for desserts like cakes and candies.

question.text: In the e-mail, what does Suzie Sanders say about the article?
choices: (A) It was written by a famous journalist.
(B) It was featured on a popular cooking website.
(C) It helped increase fan club membership.
(D) It contained excerpts from Ms. Lee’s book.

answer.text: (C) It helped increase fan club membership.
answer.explanation: The information at the beginning of the email: “the number of new members joining the fan club has been increasing drastically since it was published. I'm certain that the article in the newspaper helped generate considerable publicity for your book. ”

question.text: Accordingto Ms. Lee, what is the secret to successful cooking?

answer.explanation: Information in the following sentence in the article “she said that fresh vegetables and local produce are the key to cooking healthy and tasty food”

question.text:
To: Albert Nguyen -nguyen@wantamayolodge.com
From: Janna Zhukowsky - jzhukowsky@melodias.com
Subject: A new client
Date: April 12

Good morning, Mr.Nguyen,
Once again. It has been a pleasure working with you and the entire Wantamayo Lodge staff. My clients greatly enjoyed the rain forest tour. The couple who stayed in the South Bungalow commented that the room's view of the tropical garden was breathtaking.
I would now like to place a reservation for a new client, Robert Vasquez. Please make the following arrangements for Mr. Vasquez and his guest.
Arrival: May 5 (airport shuttle service requested)
Room type: Double occupancy
Tour type: Guided rain forest tour (6-hour hour)
Flight information:
AirPars Flight 178 from Buenos Aires arriving at 2:50 P.M May 5
AirPars Flight 152 to Buenos Aires departing at 11:00 A.M May 8
Thank you again for the high level of attention you show to my clients.
Jaunna Zhukuwsky
Travel Associate, Melodias Travel

===========================

To: Janna Zhukowsky - jzhukowsky@melodias.com
From: Albert Nguyen - nguyen@wantamayolodge.com
Subject: A new client
Date: April 13

Ms. Zhukowsky,
Thank you for your e-mail and for sharing the positive feedback from your clients.
Here are the details regarding the reservation for Mr. Vasquez. Please note that we have limited available. The room we reserved for him is slightly more expensive than others, but the only other rooms available were single rooms.
Check-in date: May 5
Check-out date: May 8
Room: South Bungalow
Price: $145 USD/night Total: $435 USD (excluding tax)
Tour type: Guided Rain Forest Tour; May 6, 8:00 A.M. to 2:00 P.M.
Tour fee: $95 USD
Note: Transportation between the airport and the lodge has been arranged. The bill must be settled in full by May 2.
We appreciate the business relationship we have with Melodias Travel. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to contact me.
Albert Nguyen
Guest Services, Wantamayo Lodge
Why did Ms. Zhukowsky write to Mr. Nguyen?
choices: (A) To suggest a new tour destination

answer.explanation:
As can be seen in the email Ms. Zhukowsky wrote “I would now like to place a reservation for a new client, Robert Vasquez. Please make the following arrangements for Mr. Vasquez and his guest ”(I want to book a new client now, Robert Vasquez. Please arrange the following for Mr. Vasquez and his guest).
As such, she is looking to help a customer with a reservation.

question.text: What is suggested about Melodias Travel?
choices: (A) It has done business with Wantamayo Lodge in the past.
(B) It specializes in rain forest destinations.
(C) It is located near Wantamayo Lodge.
(D) It is owned by Ms. Zhukowsky.

answer.text: (A) It has done business with Wantamayo Lodge in the past.
answer.explanation: From what Ms. Zhukowsky wrote in the email “Once Again. It has been a pleasure working with you and the entire Wantamayo Lodge staff. My clients greatly enjoyed the rain forest tour ”(Once again. It is a great honor to work with you and the entire Wantamayo Lodge staff. My clients greatly enjoyed the rainforest tour). As can be seen, Melodias Travel had previously worked with Wantamayo Lodge on tours for customers.

question.text: What does Mr. Vasquez request?

answer.explanation: We see in the email that there is a mention of Mr. Vasquez's “airport shuttle service requested”. So of the given answers, only D is correct.

question.text: What is indicated about Mr. Vasquez?
choices: (A) He has visited Wantamayo Lodge on a previous occasion.
(B) He will stay in a room overlooking a garden.
(C) He has traveled with Mr. Nguyen.

answer.text: (B) He will stay in a room overlooking a garden.
answer.explanation:
According to the second email, we learn that Mr. Vasquez will be staying in a room called South Bungalow. Also in the first email, the guest Ms. Zhukowsky mentioned commented that the room named South Bungalow has a beautiful tropical garden view “The couple who stayed in the South Bungalow commented that the room's view of the tropical garden was breathtaking. ” (The couple who stayed at South Bungalow commented that the view of the room to the tropical garden was breathtakingly beautiful.)
It then deduced that Mr. Vasquez would be in a room overlooking the garden.

question.text: By when does Mr. Nguyen expect payment?

answer.explanation: In Mr. Nguyen's email, it says "The bill must be settled in full by May 2"
